metadata.title: CVE-2015-6654 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The xenmem_add_to_physmap_one function in arch/arm/mm.c in Xen 4.5.x,4.4.x, and earlier does not limit the number of printk console messageswhen reporting a failure to retrieve a reference on a foreign page, whichallows remote domains to cause a denial of service by leveragingpermissions to map the memory of a foreign guest.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6654` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xen-utils-common - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xenstore-utils - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
